title: BBC Local Live: Leicestershire on Tuesday 13 December 2016 - BBC News
summary: lottery invests £ 300k in saffron lane project .
was rare £ 5 note spent in melton pie shop ?
winter night shelter for the homeless opens .
vardy and mahrez make ballon d'or top 10 .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's all from leicestershire local live - update will start again on wednesday at 08:00 .

documents.title: weather : some brightness tomorrow afternoon
text: a number of showers around through this evening and the first part of the night before these fizzle out leaving a dry but cloudy night with lows of 8c ( 46f ) .
a cloudy start tomorrow with a couple of fog patches but these will lift and clear with the promise of something a bit brighter in the afternoon .
highs of 11c ( 52f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: foxes prepare to face bournemouth
text: tonight 's game is of huge significance - which leicester city are going to turn up ?
the one which has dispatched some european clubs and washed manchester city aside ?
or the one which could n't get the better of west brom and watford ?
let 's hope the foxes bare their teeth tonight .
author: Ian Stringer
BBC Radio Leicester Foxes commentator

documents.title: travel : crash on flyover
text: # leicester accident on burleys way towards the flyover .
burleys way down to a single lane just down from st margarets way .
avoid for now .
any idea how long it will take to clear ?
vehicles have been moved but the resulting queues on the ring road will take sometime to ease , i would still avoid .
thank you !
hopefully it 's clear by the time i get back into leicester
any idea why the traffic s so bad in ratby ?
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: high demand for homeless beds
text: co-ordinating all the groups involved in this project was an organisation called one roof leicester .
ben brown is from one roof and said they had 18 referrals last night but only managed to provide beds for 10 of them .
he said there are 46 rough sleepers in the city at the moment .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: multi-faith night shelter for homeless opens
text: leicester 's winter night shelter for the homeless spent its first night in operation last night .
over 200 people from faith groups in the city have come together and pooled their resources to improve the service .
the shelter is rotated around seven venues and provides emergency accommodation and food to homeless people .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: foxes fan describes seville ahead of champions league clash
text: simon hill from broughton astley has been a foxes fan for over 40 years and is currently in seville on holiday with his family .
he said the ramón sánchez pizjuán stadiumis `` unreal '' and that it 's `` a really family-orientated place '' .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: seville ready for foxes ' fans
text: the tourist board in seville has said the city is looking forward to hosting leicester fans in the last 16 of the champions league next year .
the foxes will be heading to spain on wednesday 22 february with the second leg at the king power stadium on 14 march .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: snooker : woollaston through to second round
text: leicester 's ben woollaston is into the second round of the scottish open after beating ross valance by four frames to one - he 'll play kyren wilson next .
tom ford is out though - he was beaten by liam highfield .
rory mcleod is currently in action .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: flat tyre on way to bournemouth
text: any mechanics heading down to bournemouth ?
the bbc radio leicester sport team has a problem
author: Jason Bourne
BBC Radio Leicester Sport

documents.title: tigers miss players for munster match
text: richard cockerill has said freddie burns will definitely miss saturday 's european champions cup clash against munster .
he went off with concussion last weekend when the tigers were beaten 38-0 .
it 's unlikely that any of their other injured players , dan cole , marcos ayerza and mike williams , will be available either .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: men sentenced for 'unprovoked attack '
text: this was an unprovoked and nasty attack that left the victim with serious injuries .
it was a brutal attack on someone they barely knew and have left him suffering both physical and emotional distress. ``
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pair jailed for attack
text: these two men have been jailed for 10 years each for assaulting a man on barclay street in leicester .
brett johnson , who lived on fosse road south , and liam turner from mcvickers close attacked a man in june leaving him with fractures to his face , eye socket and jaw .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: foxes games to be shown live
text: three leicester city matches have been for live tv coverage .
they are :
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: watch : jane austen fiver spent in melton
text: this is the man behind the special £ 5 note spent in melton on friday
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: victim has to live with rape 'for the rest of her life '
text: `` the victim in this disturbing case was left physically injured and incredibly shaken by the ordeal and thankfully will now not have to face the further trauma of a trial .
her bravery in coming forward and reporting this to police must be acknowledged , however , what happened to her that day will be something she will live with for the rest of her life . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rapist tracked down in luton
text: podlaszczyk subjected his victim to a violent and sustained assault as she innocently walked through the park while on her way to work that morning .
in his haste to flee , he left his belongings at the scene and went on to use the woman 's bank card and mobile phone .
investigations led officers to find podlaszczyk in luton , where he was later arrested . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man admits raping woman in bede park
text: police have just told us about a man who pleaded guilty to raping a woman in bede park in leicester .
michal cezary podlaszczyk admitted several charges against him , including three counts of rape , two counts of sexual assault and one count of assault .
it happened on the morning of 29 october .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: members vote for football boss to stay
text: we 've been in touch with the man dmu is taking legal action against - nick langton .
the beaumont town licensee said he was first made aware of the legal proceedings today .
mr langton said : `` we had a club meeting a couple of weeks ago with members , and there was a unanimous vote for me and the general committee to stay on .
`` that included a commitment for me to continue working with de montfort university and move things forward . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football facilities to stay closed into the new year
text: de montfort university says it believes nick langton to be in breach of the licence and no longer wishes to work with him .
it said it has offered to help with the setting up of a new board with a `` properly constituted btfc '' .
but in the meantime it said beaumont park will remain closed for a notice period of 30 working days .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: beaumont park : concerns over club finances
text: the university has said it has `` concerns at the lack of financial transparency at the club '' .
dmu said in a statement it has asked to see the club 's annual accounts but it had n't provided this information .
an issue has also been raised about the clubhouse being hired out as a private venue .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: beaumont park row : university takes legal action
text: remember the story about a row over access to the football facilities at beaumont park ?
the argument was between beaumont town football club and de montfort university who share the site .
well there 's been a development
dmu has said in the wake of a protest last month , it 's taking legal action to end nick langton 's tenure as licensee of the club .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: furniture needed
text: the city council has just tweeted this appeal for furniture
we 're appealing for donations for our reuse # furniturebank scheme to help people in crisis in # leicester
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: university tests real and fake saffron
text: the university of leicester 's department of genetics has been looking at ways to tell real saffron from fake .
professor heslop-harrison claims that one of the key ways is spot the difference is its distinct smell .
he said that while fake saffron will have almost no aroma , the smallest amount of genuine saffron will have a `` characteristic smell '' .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: do you have the special note ?
text: so if you went to ye olde pork pie shoppe on friday and you were given one of the new £ 5 notes as change , chances are you could have the special note .
this is what you 're looking for
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: was limited edition fiver spent in pork pie shop ?
text: it 's thought one of these special notes was spent at ye olde pork pie shoppe in melton mowbray .
stephen hallam is the managing director of dickinson and morris - he found out yesterday that one of the notes was spent in the store on friday ( he got a call from the leicester mercury ) .
he told bbc radio leicester they checked their £ 5 notes last night but have n't found it .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: special £ 5 note in leicestershire
text: if you 've got one of the new £ 5 notes in your purse or wallet you might want to check it
this is because an engraved fiver worth up to £ 50,000 is thought to be somewhere in leicestershire .
it 's one of four new banknotes that are in circulation which have tiny works of art engraved on them by the artist graham short .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: wanted : pet food , treats , beds and toys
text: animal welfare charity workers , who rescued a dog that was found on a building site in rothley , are asking for donations for pets without homes after the public helped fund vital surgery .
author: Loughborough Echo

documents.title: m1 petrol warning
text: warning for anyone setting off on the m1
please be aware there will be no access to fuel at @ twitterid services at 10:00 for two hours while electrical testing takes place .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: students hope hampers will bring smiles to faces
text: rozella is one of the students helping out at melton vale post-16 centre and she 's been watching videos about where the hampers will be going .
she said : `` one of the videos shows some of the old people they 'll be going to wo n't have seen anybody in about a month and it 's really important because no-one should be alone at christmas .
`` i think because we 're going to see them later it will really brighten up their year . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : christmas hampers for the elderly
text: students at melton vale post-16 centre have created 60 hampers for elderly locals
between them they 've collected over 600 items to make up these hampers .
author: Helen McCarthy
BBC Radio Leicester reporter

documents.title: your photos : sunrise in east leake
text: a beautiful red sunrise in east leake this morning , captured by maggie t
author: BBC Weather Watchers

text: latest headlines for leicestershire

BBC Local Live

documents.title: snooker : mcleod in scottish open action
text: leicester 's rory mcleod faces mark davis in the opening round of the scottish open .
play 's due to begin at 14:00 .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: watch : project works to prevent social exclusion
text: gary fox is the project manager of the saffron young people 's project - here he explains why it 's so important
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: lottery cash invested in deprived city area
text: there 's some great news this morning for young people living in the saffron lane area of leicester .
almost £ 300,000 is going to be spent on giving teenagers help with things like life skills , job-seeking and health advice .
the money is coming from the big lottery .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

a proud moment !

documents.title: mahrez and vardy make top eight for ballon d'or award
text: it was a good night all round for riyad mahrez not long after he found out he was bbc african player of the year 2016 , he was named as 7th for the ballon d'or .
foxes jamie vardy took 8th place - he was the only englishman on the 30-player shortlist .
it was won by cristiano ronaldo .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: travel : crash on a46
text: i think they mean it 's `` blocking '' a lane
accident on the a46 clocking a lane as you pass the a6 junction from the hobby horse island heading towards the a50
has been moved to side of the road just rubbernecking now !
thanks matthew .
it 's slower on the opposite side to where the accident was now !
forgive my ignorance but where is hobby horse island ?
there 's a pub called the hobby horse as the a46 turns away from the a607 onto the leicester western bypass .
that island : )
ahhh many thanks .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

BBC weather presenter

documents.title: ranieri sings praise for award-winning mahrez
text: just as yesterday 's live stream was ending we found out leicester city 's riyad mahrez had been named bbc african footballer of the year 2016 .
he beat off competition from the likes of andre ayew , sadio mane and yaya toure .
his leicester boss claudio ranieri said : `` he 's a fantastic player , he 's very important for us , for the team .
he is improving every day . ''
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: today 's big
text: the photo at the top of today 's page was uploaded by one of our bbc weather watchers using the name scottnoodle1 .
it was taken in the village of heather in north-west leicestershire
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live news coverage
text: hello leicestershire - i hope you 're all well this tuesday morning .
i 'll be writing the updates on this local live page today keeping you up-to-date with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel .
if you would like to comment on any of the day 's stories you can send an email or use facebook or twitter .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live
